title: [BUG] --continue header pinning breaks scrollback
description: In TUI resume/continue flow, header appears pinned to top and bottom fills with blank lines while scrolling. Desired behavior: bottom UI stays locked; top/header should not be force-pinned except when actively composing input.

logs.msg: Starting investigation in run/render_state resume path. Goal: stop header pinning and bottom newline accumulation during scrollback in --continue.

Root cause: startup resume path sets ChatPosition::Tracking when history fits viewport (position_after_reprint), which top-anchors UI/header and leaves large blank region. Patched run.rs to force Scrolling mode after resume reprint.
Validation: cargo test passed (434 tests).

Adjusted startup resume reprint: when history is shorter than available chat rows, apply ScrollDown padding so content is bottom-aligned above UI (no top pinning for short history). Keep position Scrolling for bottom-locked UI.
Re-evaluating fix quality: user reports current behavior still wrong. Performing full resume render-path audit to replace startup padding workaround with source-level layouted reprint.

Replaced workaround with source-level startup resume layout: build lines first, compute available chat rows, render short histories at computed start_row above UI, render long histories from top with overflow trim; mark reflow complete and force Scrolling mode.
User requested no alignment. Updated startup resume path to render history from row 0 and only trim overflow for UI. Removed short-history start-row alignment logic.
Fix follow-up: cap resume overflow trim to visible viewport (min(line_count, term_height)) to avoid overscroll on long histories.
Adopted requested behavior: resume now uses position_after_reprint state directly (Tracking when chat+UI fits, Scrolling only on overflow). Removed forced Scrolling override.

Review pass: found state-order bug in in-session /resume path. load_session() resets render_state.position=Empty (src/tui/session/lifecycle.rs:53), prepare_frame queues PrintHeader and chat_lines in same frame (src/tui/run.rs:135-144), but plan_chat_insert uses pre-op state before pre-ops run (src/tui/run.rs:695-704) so Empty maps to ScrollInsert (src/tui/run.rs:194-201). This can misplace chat/UI and reintroduce pinning/blank-line artifacts for /resume via selector.

Review pass: /clear currently over-scrolls full viewport after reset. /clear sets render_state to Empty then needs_screen_clear (src/tui/events.rs:487-490). prepare_frame computes scroll_amount from Empty (src/tui/run.rs:96-103), and ChatPosition::Empty.scroll_amount returns term_height (src/tui/render_state.rs:148), so ClearScreen uses ScrollUp(term_height) (src/tui/run.rs:233-238) and pushes blank lines into scrollback.
Validation: cargo test -q passes (434 tests). No compile regressions in current tree.

Implementing source-level fix plan: 1) in-session /resume triggers full reflow and suppresses selector-clear-only path, 2) reflow frame suppresses incremental chat insert to avoid duplicate/stale planning, 3) /clear uses full viewport clear when state already reset to Empty, 4) ScrollInsert updates render_state.position.

Implemented fixes: run.rs now treats /clear reset path as full viewport clear (no ScrollUp blank rows), schedules no incremental chat insertion during reflow frames, updates position after ScrollInsert, and plans ChatPosition::Empty as tracking-until-overflow. events.rs session selection now triggers needs_reflow and suppresses selector-clear path after successful load. render_state.rs reset_for_session_load now preserves position to compute accurate pre-reflow scroll amount.
Post-fix validation: cargo test -q passes (434 tests).

Context-save handoff (2026-02-11): source-level run/events/render_state fixes are committed and lean regression tests were added in follow-up; remaining work is manual visual verification + resize/selector edge-case sweep under Sprint 16 before closing this bug.

Applied two source updates: 1) ChatPosition::Empty scroll_amount now returns 0 (was term_height) to avoid blank-line overscroll in empty-state reflow paths, 2) normalized TUI separator glyphs from '·' to '•' in events/status/progress/selector UI strings. cargo test -q: 436 passing.

Residual edge to verify: in pre-message states (Header/Empty), ui_drawn_at is not tracked, so popup/selector height shrink could leave stale rows above current top. Not reproduced yet; include in manual checklist during resize/completer/selector transitions before closing.

Implemented selector-clear source fix for Header/Empty edge cases: added RenderState.selector_clear_from queue/cancel/take methods, captured selector top on exit_selector_mode(), and changed run.rs PreOp::ClearSelectorArea to clear from captured row instead of recomputed input layout top. This prevents stale selector rows above UI when selector height shrinks while avoiding chat-area over-clear. Added unit test selector_clear_queue_take_cancel. cargo test -q: 437 passed.

Follow-up hardening: tracked last selector render top in RenderState (note_selector_top called from draw_direct in selector mode) and queue_selector_clear now falls back to that top when position.last_ui_top is unavailable (Header/Empty). This closes the remaining pre-message selector-clear gap identified in prior note. cargo test -q still 437 passed.

Added frame-order guard in prepare_frame: if selector clear and reflow are both pending, selector clear is canceled so it cannot run after reflow and erase newly reprinted chat rows. This narrows resize/selector transition regressions. cargo test -q remains 437 passing.

Lean no-behavior refactor in src/tui/run.rs: extracted rendered_entry_count() helper and startup reprint logic into reprint_loaded_session(), removing duplicated in-place logic from reflow/startup paths. cargo test -q: 437 passed.

Additional no-behavior run.rs cleanup: extracted shared terminal helpers scroll_up_and_home(), write_lines(), and write_lines_at(); replaced duplicated loops/commands in pre-ops, chat insertion, and startup reprint. cargo test -q stays green at 437 passing.

Further no-behavior run.rs simplification: extracted clear_header_areas(), apply_pre_ops(), and apply_chat_insert() from render_frame; preserved execution order/invariants while reducing nesting. cargo test -q still 437 passing.

Sprint17 usability hardening overlap: fixed stale retry-status display in src/tui/session/update.rs by clearing on ToolCallStart/ThinkingDelta/TextDelta progress events (not just TextDelta). Added unit tests; cargo test -q now 439 passing.

Agent/TUI flow hardening continued: queued steering/input is now preserved across turn completion and finish/error transitions; added late-drain in Agent::run_task and queue-restore into composer in TUI update. Also recovered poisoned queue locks in input recall path.

TUI render safety pass: removed runtime unwraps from src/tui/chat_renderer.rs and src/tui/table.rs in parser/wrapping loops; replaced with guarded iteration to eliminate panic risk on malformed edge inputs.

Startup session reprint no longer uses ScrollUp(cursor_y+1). Switched src/tui/run.rs::reprint_loaded_session to Clear(All)+MoveTo(0,0) before writing chat lines to eliminate phantom blank-row insertion during --continue. Validation: cargo test -q (444 passed), cargo clippy -q clean.

Remaining gate is manual visual verification checklist (ai/review/tui-manual-checklist-2026-02.md). Startup reprint source fix committed as 8338866; automated suite remains green at 444 tests + clippy clean.

2026-02-11 user repro: Ghostty TERM=xterm-ghostty, 68x141. On narrower resize words cut off and duplicated history/prompt/progress lines appear; Shift+Enter composer growth overwrites history and shrink leaves missing history; paste indicator repeats as 'Pasted #1'; prompt can scroll into history region.

Applied source fixes for Ghostty repro: prepare_frame now forces reflow when UI top intrudes into tracked chat (prevents Shift+Enter/composer growth from erasing history), chat_renderer wrap gate now uses display width instead of char count, and ComposerBuffer paste blob ids are monotonic across clear to avoid repeated «Pasted #1».

Validation after patch: cargo fmt; cargo test -q tui:: (178 passed); cargo clippy -q clean. Full cargo test -q fails in this environment due existing reqwest/system-configuration mac proxy panics (40 failures), unrelated to TUI patch.

Fix for small-width duplicate redraws: progress/status rows now render width-bounded single-line text (truncate_to_display_width, width-1 safety) to prevent terminal autowrap from pushing scrollback and corrupting frame layout. Added util tests for unicode-aware display-width truncation. Validation: cargo clippy -q clean; cargo test -q tui:: (180 passed).

Render-path hardening pass: added display-width utilities and width clamping in popup/history/selector renderers to prevent terminal autowrap from corrupting frame redraws at narrow widths. Also removed Unicode-unsafe byte slicing in file completer truncation path (char-based tail). Validation: cargo clippy -q clean; cargo test -q tui:: (181 passed).

Patched remaining narrow-width redraw risk: horizontal input borders now reserve last terminal column (no full-width border autowrap), input chunks are width-clamped defensively, and input cursor placement is clamped to visible input region/terminal width to avoid out-of-bounds cursor moves during resize/composer growth.
Validation: cargo test -q tui:: (181 passed), cargo clippy -q clean, cargo fmt.

Follow-up render-state hardening: added RenderState.last_ui_top fallback tracked from draw_direct each frame (including Empty/Header states). compute_layout clear_from now uses render_state.last_ui_top() so UI shrink can clear stale rows even without Tracking/Scrolling position anchors.
Added tests for last_ui_top fallback behavior and reset semantics; validation: cargo test -q tui::render_state, cargo test -q tui::, cargo clippy -q, cargo fmt.

Regression fix: restored colorized status mode label rendering ([READ]=cyan, [WRITE]=yellow) and thinking label magenta while preserving width-safe clipping (last-column reserve) and dimmed token usage in status row.
Validation: cargo fmt; cargo test -q tui:: (182 passed); cargo test -q tui::run (8 passed); cargo clippy -q clean.
Reprioritized 2026-02-12: manual checklist closure is no longer current gate while RNK/core TUI direction is being evaluated. Keep as fallback regression task.
Priority lowered to p3 while RNK spike drives current TUI direction; keep as fallback regression stream.

2026-02-13: User still reproduces intermittent duplicate top blocks and malformed wrapped indentation when repeatedly moving between monitors + aggressive resize churn. Root-cause candidate narrowed: resize/reflow interaction with wrapped markdown replay and scrollback write semantics; keep open as fallback regression tracker while tk-add8/tk-bcau continue.
